DataElement.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Solid Tumor Spread Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the spread of a solid tumor using the Charlson Comorbity Index.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Solid Neoplasm Spread
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score._A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors._The act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score.

Concepts.definition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score.

Property.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors.:The act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from tissues that do not include fluid areas.  Representative examples include epithelial neoplasms (e.g. lung carcinoma, prostate carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma), and neoplasms arising from the soft tissues and bones (e.g. leiomyosarcoma, liposarcoma, chondrosarcoma, osteosarcoma).  Neoplasms originating from the blood or bone marrow (leukemias and myeloproliferative disorders) are not considered solid tumors.
The act of extending over a wider scope or expanse of space or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 11/13/20 Princess Margaret CDE request. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Restricted to the site of origin, without evidence of spread.

Concepts.definition: Restricted to the site of origin, without evidence of spread.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
